H0.text: It will sink when a lump of clay is dropped into water.

H1.text: Will float is what occurs when a lump of clay is dropped into water.

H2.text: Will dissolve is what will occur when a lump of clay is dropped into water.

H3.text: Will break up will occur when a lump of clay is dropped into water.

A4.text: Clay, relatively impermeable to water, is also used where natural seals are needed, such as in pond linings, the cores of dams, or as a barrier in landfills against toxic seepage.

A5.text: An object whose weight exceeds its buoyancy tends to sink.

A6.text: An object which tends to sink will eventually have a normal force of constraint N exerted upon it by the solid floor.
